org.apache.mina.integration.spring
Class Binding

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.mina.integration.spring.Binding
All Implemented Interfaces:
InitializingBean
public class Binding
extends Object
implements InitializingBean

Defines an address to IoHandler binding. This is used when specifying the addresses to accept new connections on when creating IoAcceptor objects using one of the AbstractIoAcceptorFactoryBean sub-classes.

This class also allows for an optional list of filters to be associated with the address. The IoAcceptor will add all these filters to the filter chain of sessions created for incoming connections on the address specified by this binding. This makes it possible to specify different filters depending on the port the client is connecting on (e.g. using an SSLFilter when connecting on port 443 but not on port 80).

Version:
$Rev$, $Date$
Author:
The Apache Directory Project (dev@directory.apache.org)

Method Detail

getAddress

public String getAddress()
Returns the address the handler of this object will be bound to. See setAddress(String) for more information on the format of this string.

Returns:
the textual representation of the transport type specific address.

setAddress

public void setAddress(String address)
Sets the address the handler of this object will be bound to. The format of this address depends on the transport type of the IoAcceptor this binding will be used for. When creating a SocketAcceptor using SocketAcceptorFactoryBean the format looks like [<interface>:]port, e.g. 127.0.0.1:8080. getAddress()

Parameters:
address - the textual representation of the transport type specific address.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified value is null.

setFilters

public void setFilters(IoFilter[] filters)
Sets a number of unnamed filters. These will be added to the filter chain of sessions created when a connection is made on the address specified by this binding. The filters will be assigned automatically generated names (portFilter0, portFilter1, etc).

Parameters:
filters - the filters.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified value is null.

setFilterMappings

public void setFilterMappings(IoFilterMapping[] filterMappings)
Sets a number of named filters. These will be added to the filter chain of sessions created when a connection is made on the address specified by this binding.

Parameters:
filterMappings - the name to filter mappings.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified value is null.

the mappings.
